page.title: 02Visitors to Brownsea
page.content: Many visitors come to Brownsea every year and some parts of the island make ideal picnic sites. It is possible that picnics will be interrupted by peacocks or "tame" pheasants or ducks demanding scraps. The other wilder creatures (the red squirrels rabbits and deer) keep the grass close cropped but are more difficult to see. When asked about their impressions of Brownsea, visitors made these comments: "The Nature Reserve is the best part of the island." "We came to see the wild-life and there are nice walks." "There is no chemist or any decent shops." "Its marvellous that there are no cars."
